intro: Beadlea elata, commonly known as the slender beadlea, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in whorls along the stem. Beadlea elata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
